markets.title: Will Coinbase Global, Inc. run a Super Bowl ad in 2025?
markets.rules_primary: If Coinbase Global, Inc. has an ad during the 2025 Football Championship national broadcast after kick-off and before the game ends, then the market resolves to Yes.
markets.rules_secondary:
Clarification 1/26/25 3:00 AM ET: (1) The market called "Budweiser" refers to any advertisement regarding a product of the "Budweiser Family" as defined in Anheuser-Busch 10K filings. This includes but is not limited to Budweiser, Budweiser Select, Bud Light, and Bud Ice. An advertisement for "Cutwater" or "Nutrl" would not satisfy the payout criterion.
Clarification 1/26/25: (2) The market called "Verizon" refers to any advertisement including services they power or provide (if strictly mentioned in the advertisement). This includes but is not limited to an advertisement for "Visible by Verizon" that clearly states/displays "Verizon" in its ad. An advertisement for "Total Wireless" would not satisfy the payout criterion unless the ad clearly states/displays "Verizon" in its ad. 

Additional Clarification 1/26/25: For Budweiser, if any product in the "Budweiser" family is advertised during the game, the market resolves to Yes. That includes Budweiser, Budweiser Select, Bud Light, and Bud Ice. For Pepsi, if any product sold by PepsiCo is advertised during the game, the market resolves to Yes. That includes, for example, Doritos. For Coca-Cola, if any product sold by the Coca-Cola Company is advertised during the game, the market resolves to Yes. That includes, for example, "Fanta" and "Fairlife." For Apple, if any product sold by Apple Inc. is advertised during the game, the market resolves to Yes. That includes, for example, Beats headphones. Additional Clarification 1/28/25 3:00 AM ET: An ad is aired if it is aired as part of a promotional advertisement during a commercial break. An announcer during the game saying, "This is brought to you by <company>" or a viral marketing stunt during the game is not encompassed by the Payout Criterion. The strikes "Toyota" and "Hyundai" encompass any product created by those companies, even if they are not part of the "Toyota" or "Hyundai" brands within those companies. For example, a Lexus ad would resolve the Toyota market to "Yes".
